metrics module¶

Evaluation metrics module.

metrics.MSE_score(video: numpy.ndarray, ref: str = 'previous') → float[source]¶

Return MSE score with respect to some reference image.

This method is tested on 2D videos, but should work on 3D videos as well.

Parameters

  • video – numpy array containing the video information

  • ref – reference frame/image to use as approx for round-truth. Either: previous, median or mean Default is ‘previous’

metrics.cont_dice_scores(video: numpy.ndarray) → float[source]¶
metrics.failure_score(video: numpy.ndarray, frame_shape: Optional[tuple] = None) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Return percentage of frames considered ‘failed’ due to remoteness to the center.

An important assumption this score makes is that the mean over the centers of mass of the input :param:`video` is suposed to represent a proper center were all axons are visible.

metrics.get_centers(video: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Return each frame’s center of mass.

metrics.get_correlation_scores(video: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

For each frame, return a score from 0 to 1 on how correlated it is to the mean frame.

metrics.get_correlation_scores_prev(video: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

For each frame, return a score from 0 to 1 on how correlated it is to the next frame.

2p-stabilizer
